QueryText: Control measures for coconut stem bleeding disease
KccAns: Chisel out the affected portion and apply Calyxin 5ml100ml water  and paste next day  coltarr or rubber coat 5 ml clyxin 300 ml water - root feeding take healthy root slanding cut to the tip  and dip  done  two month interval  in three times  in 6 month time period or 25 ml calyxin 25 liter water and drench the moist base at monthly interwal for 3 months Apply 10kg  veppinpinnaku  Neem cake

KccAns: Recommended to chisel out the affected tissue and dress the wound with Hexaconazole 5 EC  5ml in 100 ml water Apply coal tar after 2 days Burn off chiselled pieces Avoid any mechanical injury to the stemTo avoid spread of disease on to upper portion of trunk root feed with Hexaconazole 5 EC 5 ml 100 ml of water at 3 times a year - April-May Spetember-October and January-February Drench the wet basin with 25 ml of Hexaconazole 5 EC 1 ml  litre of water 25 litre palmAlong with 50 kg organic manure apply 5 kg neem cake containing  Trichoderma culture to the basin during September Provide adequate irrigation during summerb and drainage during rainy season

QueryText: Stem bleeding disease in Coconut
KccAns: For the management of Stem Bleeding in Coconut it was recommended to chisel out the affected tissue wound dress with Hexaconazole 5 EC 5ml in 100 ml water and to drench the wet basin with 25 ml of Hexaconazole 5 EC 1 ml  litre of water 25 litre palm Also suggested to give the recommended dose of fertilizers 50Kg Organic manure and 5Kg neem cake per palm per year
